means: 论道德，说教( moralize的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: You should avoid saying " It's for the best " or other such moralizing platitudes.
sentence.Network_cn: 你应避免说类似 “ 一切到最后都会好的 ” 或诸如此类的陈词滥调.

sentence.Network_en: He could spend hours in surveying its creeping progress, in moralizing over its mechanism.
sentence.Network_cn: 他可以一连几个小时望着它爬行, 并指出其中寓意.

sentence.Network_en: She's always moralizing about the behaviour of today's young people.
sentence.Network_cn: 她总是就当今青年人待人的态度方面进行说教.

list.abs: 道德之实落在仁义﹐这才是道德(moral)的真正意义。「道德」这个词在儒家的实义就是仁义。
英语词根6 - Leo.Zhu - 博客园 ... remonstration n 抗议，反对 moral a 道德的 mural a 墙壁的 n.壁画.
求M开头的所有单词！！谁多采纳谁？_爱问知识人 ... monster n.怪物，妖怪 morality n.道德，品行 mourn v．哀悼，哀伤.
大学英语精读单词表(第三册) - 豆丁网 ... doorway n. 门口； 门道 morally ad. 道德上 moral a. 道德上的.
生产管理 - MBA智库百科 ... (5)安全( S：Safety) (6)士气( M：Morale) (1)效率( P：Productivity).

entry.tran: 进行训诫，进行说教，教化
entry.def: If you say that someone is moralizing, you are critical of them for telling people what they think is right or wrong, especially when they have not been asked their opinion.

example.ex: As a dramatist I hate to moralize...
example.tran: 作为一名剧作家，我憎恨说教。

example.ex: Society in general moralized about 'loose women'.
example.tran: 社会通常会对那些“浪荡女子”指指点点。

means.word_mean: 1. indulgence in moral pronouncements; the exposition (often superficially) of a particular moral code;
